Prerequisites: ACG 2021 WITH A GRADE OF "C-" OR BETTER
Course Description: A STUDY OF THE ACCOUNTANT'S ROLE IN ASSISTING MANAGEMENT IN THE PLANNING AND CONTROLLING OF BUSINESS ACTIVITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
OBJECTIVES:

AS DECISION MAKERS WHO ACCOMPLISH GOALS AND OBJECTIVES THROUGH OTHERS, MANAGERS NEED FINANCIAL INFORMATION THAT IS TIMELY, RELEVANT, AND USEFUL FOR FORMULATING STRATEGIES AND POLICIES, MAKING NON-ROUTINE DECISIONS (E.G., ADDING OR DELETING A PRODUCT OR SERVICE, CHOOSING BETWEEN MAKING OR BUYING COMPONENT PARTS, DETERMINING WHETHER TO OUTSOURCE SERVICES, INVESTING IN LONG-LIVED ASSETS), AND PLANNING AND CONTROLLING ROUTINE OPERATIONS.  PUBLISHED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALMOST ALWAYS INADEQUATE FOR MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING BECAUSE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING FOCUSES ON PAST, COMPLETED TRANSACTIONS AND IS CONSTRAINED BY OUTSIDER-ORIENTED GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (GAAP).

IN MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING, THESE CONSTRAINTS ARE DROPPED AND THE EMPHASIS IS SHIFTED TO THE KINDS OF PRESENT AND FUTURE-ORIENTED INFORMATION MANAGERS NEED TO MAKE SOUND STRATEGIC AND OPERATING DECISIONS.  IN THIS CONTEMPORARY MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING COURSE, WE FOCUS ON USING ACCOUNTING INFORMATION FOR INTERNAL DECISION MAKING.  TOPICS COVERED WILL INCLUDE THE USE OF DIFFERENT COSTS FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES, COST ACCUMULATION FOR PRODUCT COSTS VS. COST ACCUMULATION FOR MANAGEMENT PLANNING AND CONTROL, COST ALLOCATION, BUDGETING, COST BEHAVIOR, TRANSFER PRICING, AND THE USE OF COST, REVENUE, AND INVESTMENT INFORMATION FOR PERFORMANCE EVALUATION.  EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON TECHNIQUES SUCH AS ACTIVITY-BASED COSTING AND ACTIVITY-BASED MANAGEMENT, JUST-IN-TIME, AND THE BALANCED SCORECARD.

OUTCOMES:

UPON COMPLETING THIS COURSE, STUDENTS SHOULD HAVE A GOOD UNDERSTANDING OF:
MANAGEMENT DECISION-MAKING
MANAGEMENT PLANNING AND CONTROL
COST ALLOCATION
BUDGETING
USE OF COST REVENUE AND INVESTMENT INFORMATION FOR PERFORMANCE EVALUATION

TOPICS:

ROLE, HISTORY AND DIRECTION OF MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING / BASIC COST CONCEPTS
ACTIVITY BASED MANAGEMENT AND COSTING
TRADITIONAL TOPICS:  JOB-ORDER COSTING, COST-VOLUME-PROFIT, RELEVANT COSTING
THEORY OF CONSTRAINTS

PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS INCLUDING THE BALANCED SCORECARD
QUALITY COSTS AND PRODUCTIVITY
